body:
>IMHO it is better to squash. There is no much value in having all this minor fixes as separate commits

Does it really hurt?
Minor commits enable to view intentions and the relevant changes itself.
@pengzhiwei2018 , would you please rebase the patch?

> @pengzhiwei2018 , would you please rebase the patch?

done!

Hmmm bunch of errors about zip END header not found... This is partially through the build too not on the first module. This only happened on JDK 11 too. 

```
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR :
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] error reading /root/.m2/repository/org/objenesis/objenesis/2.1/objenesis-2.1.jar; zip END header not found
[ERROR] /src/spark/src/main/java/org/apache/calcite/adapter/spark/SparkRel.java:[17,1] cannot access org.apache.calcite.adapter.spark
  zip END header not found
...
```
@risdenk , would you please retry the PR?
Force pushed same changes with a slightly different commit message to retrigger the build.

Windows failures twice now (Travis figured itself out).

```
[ERROR] Tests run: 142, Failures: 4, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 5.891 s <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.calcite.rel.rel2sql.RelToSqlConverterTest
[ERROR] testUnparseInStruct1(org.apache.calcite.rel.rel2sql.RelToSqlConverterTest)  Time elapsed: 0.022 s  <<< FAILURE!

[INFO] 
[INFO] Results:
[INFO]

[ERROR]   RelToSqlConverterTest.testUnparseIn1:396 
Expected: is "SELECT *\nFROM \"scott\".\"EMP\"\nWHERE \"DEPTNO\" IN (21)"
     but: was "SELECT *\r\nFROM \"scott\".\"EMP\"\r\nWHERE \"DEPTNO\" IN (21)"
[ERROR]   RelToSqlConverterTest.testUnparseIn2:407 
Expected: is "SELECT *\nFROM \"scott\".\"EMP\"\nWHERE \"DEPTNO\" IN (20, 21)"
     but: was "SELECT *\r\nFROM \"scott\".\"EMP\"\r\nWHERE \"DEPTNO\" IN (20, 21)"
[ERROR]   RelToSqlConverterTest.testUnparseInStruct1:421 
Expected: is "SELECT *\nFROM \"scott\".\"EMP\"\nWHERE ROW(\"DEPTNO\", \"JOB\") IN (ROW(1, 'PRESIDENT'))"
     but: was "SELECT *\r\nFROM \"scott\".\"EMP\"\r\nWHERE ROW(\"DEPTNO\", \"JOB\") IN (ROW(1, 'PRESIDENT'))"
[ERROR]   RelToSqlConverterTest.testUnparseInStruct2:437 
Expected: is "SELECT *\nFROM \"scott\".\"EMP\"\nWHERE ROW(\"DEPTNO\", \"JOB\") IN (ROW(1, 'PRESIDENT'), ROW(2, 'PRESIDENT'))"

```

Looks like `\r\n` vs `\n` for string comparison. I rebased my branch on latest master in case I missed a few commits that would have fixed this.
@risdenk , Windows failure is not your fault. It is to be fixed in https://github.com/apache/calcite/pull/837
Ah ok thanks @vlsi

@pengzhiwei2018 , you tend to close and open PRs for the same ticket quite often.
That does generate email noise since it becomes really hard to identify which notifications are important and which are not.

On top of that, it splits comments since the discussion does not move from one PR to another.

Would you please get accustomed with force-push to your own development branch, so there's a single PR for the feature?

I am really sorry for that.I will keep this in mind.

2018年9月20日 下午04:33，Vladimir Sitnikov <notifications@github.com> 写道：

@pengzhiwei2018 , you tend to close and open PRs for the same ticket quite often.
That does generate email noise since it becomes really hard to identify which notifications are important and which are not.

On top of that, it splits comments since the discussion does not move from one PR to another.

Would you please get accustomed with force-push to your own development branch, so there's a single PR for the feature?

@zuozhiw , would you please rebase your branch on top of current master so we can see if tests pass or not?
+1 - only two failures is pretty good :)
Hi @vlsi and @julianhyde , Any opinion and comment about this PR?
hi @wenhuitang If you have merged the implementation of `FROM_BASE64` into #800 , you can close this PR. Thanks.

Hey @vlsi 

Just wanted to let you know that during 6 weeks, for each LGTM alert fixed, we'll make a donation to WWF. You can also win a free ticket to GitHub Universe, with travel and accommodation. Details here: https://competitions.lgtm.com/ghu-2018
@pengzhiwei2018 , Please remove added methods, and use just if (type is boolean) return rexbuilder.makeliteral(...booleanValue())
@vlsi fixed the message, please take another look

Thank you @vlsi for your quick review

I have applied your suggestions

LGTM.

Will commit if no-one objects in a day or two.

Thank you very much.
If you have time please take a look to my real problem on the mailing list
Thank you, @vlsi, for reviewing this PR.

@asereda-gs , Geode tests print a bunch of SQL to the console: https://travis-ci.org/apache/calcite/jobs/432201677#L3395

Would you please disable that output by default? (see https://github.com/apache/calcite/commit/3183f2cae6db91f0c2bb0fc99ff6121da56652b8 )
@vlsi Done
Tests fail due to #847.
@zabetak I am very interested in this change, as you know, I think it may be related to my current problems with joins and sorts.

> @zabetak I am very interested in this change, as you know, I think it may be related to my current problems with joins and sorts.

@eolivelli Unfortunately, I don't think that this fix will solve your problem. I need this change so that the SortRemoveRule can detect when the sort is redundant and remove it. In your case, I've seen that you are not using this rule so I'm not quite sure why the sort disappears.
@zabetak , does your change interfere with #691 ?

> @zabetak , does your change interfere with #691 ?

Yes, and no! Actually, the code used by the EnumerableJoin (EnumerableDefaults#join_) is able to retain the order of the outer relation. As the code is right now, the outer relation is the left input. If that changes (although I don't see a reason in this) then it will be able to retain the order of the right input.
I haven't looked a lot in this issue but the fix seems wrong. I think it breaks LEFT, RIGHT, and FULL outer joins.

Yeah, it isn't correct. I need to fix this sometime.

Yes, it is not valid to just swap `rightExpression` and `leftExpression`.
`leftResult.physType.generateAccessor(leftKeys)` and friends should be replaced as well.

Thanks for the pointer.

*l'apprenant*
I would be inclined to change the cost function so that left and right inputs are set correctly. That way the implement method would not need to be changed at all.

@zabetak , that depends on the background :)

For instance, in Oracle DB the first input is used to build the table.
This PR will create an easy conflict with #762.

Hi @vlsi,
I am addressing directly to you since you have spent quite a lot of time on this issue (again thanks:)). Do you see any other changes that should be done before we merge this PR. The more we leave it on hold, the more conflicts we are going to have with other contributions.
I wonder if the root cause is that `org.apache.calcite.adapter.enumerable.JavaRowFormat#field` ignores `Type fieldType` parameter

I am not sure if it comes from the fieldType parameter. However, I think that applying the NullAs policy to the expression is important otherwise we are going to end up with compile errors in the generated code.

Closing this, see a solution more generic:  
[Link](https://github.com/apache/calcite/pull/840)
Sorry for the delay. I've been busy (at ApacheCon). I will do my best to review it soon.
PS. I'm reviewing it.
Thanks a lot! I owe you one :)

@zabetak , none of the added tests enter `org.apache.calcite.sql2rel.org.apache.calcite.sql2rel.RelStructuredTypeFlattener.RewriteRexShuttle#visitFieldAccess.RewriteRexShuttle#visitFieldAccess`

Would you please add tests for the changes to `RelStructuredTypeFlattener` ?

@vlsi  it is true that I didn't add new tests for the RelStructuredTypeFlattener since there were some already. For instance,  SqlToRelConverterTest#testArrayOfRecord uses a nice combination of arrays and structs. There are also more tests in SqlToRelConverterTest that are passing from the visitFieldAccess method but if you want me to add more let me know.

```
select page."pageNo" from (
select au."books"[1]."pages"[1] page
from "bookstore"."authors" au)
```

throws 


The StackTrace does not seem to be related with my changes and I don't think that the Bookstore schema is to blaim here. Is it because the outer projection is not fully qualified? Did you try to give an alias to the inner table and reference the column with the alias?

```
select x.page."pageNo" from (
select au."books"[1]."pages"[1] page
from "bookstore"."authors" au) x
```

I see, probably there is a bug but still it does not look to be related with my changes. Neither the flattener nor the translator are involved in the StackTrace.

just one more thing: there's `@Ignore("[CALCITE-2505] java.lang.AssertionError: result mismatch")` test in `RexProgramTest`.

Would you please remove `@Ignore` and add the tests code to the relevant method?

From my point of view, it's better to add tests to new methods rather than making `testSimplify` bigger and bigger.

Hi @julianhyde,
Function renamed in `OracleSqlOperatorTable`. CHR removed from `Parser.jj`. VARCHAR2 removed from `reference.md`.
Please, let me know if any further changes are necessary.

I enlarged the scope of the initial JIRA to handle all enumerable join operators (therefore the change in the title and the additional commits). The comment on the top of the page is meant to be the final commit message.

@kgyrtkirk , please remove ignore here as well: https://github.com/apache/calcite/blob/b98a8e7af6504dc813a4c31c601a7003c9716775/core/src/test/java/org/apache/calcite/test/fuzzer/RexProgramFuzzyTest.java#L122
@vlsi I've removed the Ignore; the test passed for me.

The digest is overridden by every data type, so what type you mean do not have the `field` info ?

 If the digest is not complete, we can just fix it, a fall back if decision for fieldList is a little confusing.
looks good overall.

I don't really see a point to adding public API for this.

So -1 as long as public API (e.g. public interfaces) is added.

> I don't really see a point to adding public API for this.
> 
> So -1 as long as public API (e.g. public interfaces) is added.

Hi @vlsi , 

Thanks for taking a look. And could you please explain a bit more about why we don't want a public interface here?

I made the interface public just mainly for cross package accessing. Also, generally saying, developers could write custom ExceptionHandler since it is public.

> Also, generally saying, developers could write custom ExceptionHandler since it is public.

I'm ok if you mark interface/enum with `@Experemental` or `@VisibleForTesting` or with something like that.

Adding public APIs is not something that should be added for each and every reason.


PS. You seem to handle each and every EnumerableCalc, however a single query might have multiple EnumerableCalc instances. Does it really make sense to handle all of them?
What sense `log` action means? What is the result of SQL when exception is logged and/or ignored?
Are you still working on it @vlsi ?
@vlsi Thank you very much for the explanation, I have made code change and leaved my comments in [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-525), could you please take a look? Thanks.
PR closed in favor of https://github.com/apache/calcite/pull/887

@kgyrtkirk , please check http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/calcite-dev/201808.mbox/%3CEB4C7967-8C7A-48A9-9257-37FE2ED6191E@apache.org%3E

`case -> and/or` transformation is not valid with respect to evaluation order.

@vlsi , can you give an example of an expression you have in mind for which this simplification is not valid?
The simplification guards against the order problem by adding the NOT clause over the previous conditions (CALCITE-1413 description has an example).

@jcamachor , please check Julian's example in http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/calcite-dev/201808.mbox/%3CEB4C7967-8C7A-48A9-9257-37FE2ED6191E@apache.org%3E

`WHERE x > 0 AND y / x < 5` and `WHERE CASE WHEN x > 0 THEN y / x < 5 ELSE FALSE END` have different execution semantics: the first one can crash while the second one must not

Thanks @vlsi , you are right... This does not seem valid for that case indeed... Maybe we could limit the simplification to be executed iff case branches consist only of ref, constants, and comparison predicates.
I've added some extra checks to ensure that we don't end up planning for an ArithmeticException. I've assembled a whitelist of call kinds which are accepted.
JIRA Link:- https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2623

> `last.value.equals(b.value)` won't work as `RexNode`s do not implement equals/hashCode

I've added {{toString()}} calls; but I think if {{RexNode}}-s should be compared by toString(); then they could have a hashCode/equals calls backed by that...I think it would be usefull to be able to use RexNode-s as set elements - Is there any reason not to have hashCode/equals for RexNode I don't see?

@zabetak To control not to fire the rule if the filter have some correlation through a passed in (default here) predicate is not that flexible, as users we can only write it in the code or have a configuration for it, do you have any good idea for this ?

@danny0405 Actually, by default the rule does not fire when there is a correlation variable. If you want the opposite, i.e., the rule fires even if there are correlation variables then you are right you need to either write code or pass some configuration. 
The only reason that the rule does not fire when there are correlation variables is that it creates problems when the query needs to be decorrelated. In that case, we can detect when the decorrelator is used and make the appropriate adjustments without the need for user input.
If anyone has some comments on this one please let me know. Otherwise I'll commit it in a bit.

Is there a JIRA case for this? If not, you should create one as a way of tracking this. In any case, when there is, you should change the title of your PR and the commit message to start with [CALCITE-###] where ### is the issue number.

Is there a JIRA case for this? If not, you should create one as a way of tracking this. In any case, when there is, you should change the title of your PR and the commit message to start with [CALCITE-###] where ### is the issue number.

> If anyone has some comments on this one please let me know. Otherwise I'll commit it in a bit.

I'm seeing no tests in this change.
looks good to me
@michaelmior I definitely did not mean for patching the *public* 1.17 release branch. Sorry for any confusion caused! Closing the PR and deleting the branch.

I mentioned this on https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/CALCITE/issues/CALCITE-2635, but I'm not sure how to test this properly. The added overhead is only about 2 seconds, which is probably within normal variation across test environments, so I wouldn't want to hard-code something like "a query must take less than 2 seconds to plan". Even trying both ways (a big table and small table) and comparing in the same environment seems liable to false failures.

Have you got any suggestions?
@laurentgo , would you please commit it?
@vlsi , thanks for reviewing. Please let me know if latest version looks good to you so I can merge it.

@jcamachor , this looks good to me modulo tests.
e.g. the tests for `two branches collapse to "always true"`:
`case when x is true then 1 when x is not true then 1 else 2 end`
`case when x is true then 1 when true then 1 else 2 end`
@vlsi , just pushed those tests in last commit and simplification LGTM. Can you double check? If they are fine, I will merge this PR. Thanks
LGTM
I made some suggestions in the JIRA case.
Tests appear to hang. Same happens when I run locally.

@michaelmior the test cases do hang and I haven't found the reason yet. When I run the test cases under IntelliJ it works fine, but when I run it with maven, it hangs in a seemingly unknown test case. I'm still trying to figure out which test case hangs and how it's related to the new changes.
@julianhyde prodding this because on the Jira you seemed amenable to taking a peek. This is a step towards Beam being able to use Calcite's codegen for Calc.

@zhztheplayer , it looks like you mark `EnumerableWindow` to return "empty collation". Would you please just return proper collation?
For instance, if no partition is present, then `EnumerableWindow` keeps `order by` collation.

> @zhztheplayer , it looks like you mark `EnumerableWindow` to return "empty collation". Would you please just return proper collation?
> For instance, if no partition is present, then `EnumerableWindow` keeps `order by` collation.

Agree. I suggest to changes inside EnumerableWindowRule or nearby, since we could not predicate collations of the custom implementations of LogicalWindow.
@vlsi The PR has been updated.
Hi @julianhyde , I have rebased this PR, do you have time to have a look ?

I believe that current collation's implementation is basically for Calcite's enumerable rels, and also for data systems that have "deterministic" row ordering just like Calcite's enumerable rels, so myself have no objection with this design.

I am not sure if Calcite provides a way to deeply custom the collation's implementation, at least users could disable the collation traits in their planner config.
Let's discuss at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-1912.

Thanks @rubenada , but there may be 2 more points to check:

1. RelDataTypeFactoryImpl#createTypeWithNullability may need to modified since it is still changing struct field nullability.
2. Join#deriveRowType is still leveraging record nullability rather than field nullability to determine row type.

squeeze the changes into one, 
and close previous PRs  if they are no longer valid.
and format PR tittles like other PRs
looks good over all, don't forget to combine the commits into one.
